title: Version
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on an iPhone or iPad with iOS 10.3 or above
custom_steps: WHEN the user launches & accesses MiLB
custom_expected: THEN the user is presented with the option to update their home screen icon

title: Team Modal - Change Icon
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in the on-boarding process of MiLB and selects a Favorite Team
and finishes on boarding

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the team page
custom_steps_separated.expected: The user is presented with a Personalize your home screen modal

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the modal text
custom_steps_separated.expected:
When the modal text will be:
Personalize your home screen
Select the <Team> to be your home screen icon
Current Home Screen Icon
Not Now button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the modal
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the modal will display:
Current logo (MLB.com icon)
Favorite Team logo

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the favorite team's logo
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then it will update the team icon
and dismiss the modal

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps Not Now
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then this will dismiss the modal but doesn't update the user's icon

title: Team Modal - Dismiss Modal
custom_preconds:
Given the user is in the on-boarding process of MiLB and selects a Favorite Team
and finishes on boarding

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is on the team page
custom_steps_separated.expected: The user is presented with a Personalize your home screen modal

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the modal text
custom_steps_separated.expected:
When the modal text will be:
Personalize your home screen
Select the <Team> to be your home screen icon
Current Home Screen Icon
Not Now button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the modal
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the modal will display:
Current logo (MLB.com icon)
Favorite Team logo

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps Not Now
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then this will dismiss the modal but doesn't update the user's icon

title: Changing Favorite Team
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has selected a favorite team
custom_steps:
WHEN the user changes their favorite team
AND navigates to the newly selected Favorite Team Page
custom_expected: THEN the user is presented with modal which gives the user the option to update their home screen icon when they land on the new favorite team page

title: Team Settings
custom_preconds: Given a user taps on More, Teams, selects a team
custom_steps: When a user taps on a team's Settings button
custom_expected: Then a user is on the corresponding team's Setting page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Set Home Screen Icon button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then it opens the Set App Icon view

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has MiLB.com icon as the current icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Reset to MiLB text is not highlighted
and not tappable

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has a team logo as the current icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Reset to MiLB text is highlighted in Favorite Team color
and the button is tappable

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Current Icon updates to the new team logo
and Personalize your home screen text updates with the new team name
and the user receives a iOS controlled prompt informing they changed their icon

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has a team setup
and taps on Reset to MiLB
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Current Icon updates to the MiLB.com icon
and Personalize your home screen text updates
and the user receives a iOS controlled prompt informing they changed their icon

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user taps on the team
and taps back
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team settings page will reflect the new icon

title: App Settings
custom_preconds: When a user taps on More, Settings
custom_steps:
When a user is on the Settings view
and taps on Set Home Screen Icon
custom_expected: Then the user will be taken to the Home Screen Icon view

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the Home Screen Icon page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a section with the current icon
and Personalize your home screen information text

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has MiLB.com icon as the current icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Reset to MiLB text is not highlighted
and not tappable

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user has a team logo as the current icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Reset to MiLB text is highlighted in Favorite Team color
and the button is tappable

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user has a Favorite team(s) set
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the favorite team(s) will be seen under it's own header
and if multiple favorite teams then organized in the order specified by the user in the their favorites settings

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user removes a favorite team
or changes the order of favorite team
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the favorite team(s) will be updated under it's own header

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user swipes down the Home Screen Icon page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the correct teams under the correct league and division

International League North, 
International League South, 
International League West, 
Pacific Coast League American Northern, 
Pacific Coast League American Southern, 
Pacific Coast League Pacific Northern, 
Pacific Coast League Pacific Southern, 
Eastern League Eastern,
Eastern League Western,
Southern League North,
Southern League South,
Texas League North,
Texas League South,
Carolina League Northern,
Carolina League Southern,
Florida State League North, 
Florida State League South, 
Midwest League Eastern,
Midwest League Western,
South Atlantic League Northern,
South Atlantic League Southern,
New York-Penn League McNamara,
New York-Penn League Pinckney,
New York-Penn League Stedler,
Northwest League North,
Northwest League South,
Appalachian League East, 
Appalachian League West,
Pioneer League North, 
Pioneer League South

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on a team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Current Icon updates to the new team logo
and Personalize your home screen text updates with the new team name

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has a team setup
and taps on another team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Current Icon updates to the new team logo
and Personalize your home screen text updates with the new team name

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on Reset to MiLB
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Current Icon updates to the MiLB.com logo
and Personalize your home screen text updates

title: New Build / Upgrade
custom_preconds: Given the user has MiLB installed on the device

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has the favorite team icon
and installs a new build
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the modal on first landing on the favorite team page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has the favorite team icon
and installs a new build
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will not see the modal on the first landing on the favorite team page

title: Custom App Icon
custom_preconds: Given a user has MiLB on an iOS 10.3 device
custom_steps: When the user navigates to the following:

custom_steps_separated.content: Home Screen Icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then custom app icon is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: Widget
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then custom app icon is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: Spotlight Search
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then custom app icon is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: Notification
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then notifications display with the default MLB shield icon

custom_steps_separated.content: Long press app icon on 3D Touch supported device
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then custom app icon is displayed

title: One Favorite Team
custom_preconds: Given a user has iOS 10.3 on a device
custom_steps:
When a user has a Favorite Team
and a user swipes down on the Team Page to Settings
and taps on Settings
custom_expected: Then the user is able to set that team as custom app icon

title: Icon Name
custom_preconds: Given a user has MiLB on an iOS 10.3 device
custom_steps: When the user views the favorite team name icon on the home screen
custom_expected: Then the user will see the name of the app (First Pitch) below the icon, not the team name

title: Modals Displays Under These Circumstances
custom_preconds: GIVEN as a product owner, I want to present users with the option to update their home screen icon
custom_steps: WHEN we control when a user sees this modal
custom_expected: THEN the modal can be displayed in the following scenarios:

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user first lands on the favorite team page after installing a particular build
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is presented with the option to update their home screen icon

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user has not set a team to be set for a homes screen icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN show the option to update their home screen icon (only if the icon is not currently set to that team)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is on their top favorite team page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN show the option to update their home screen icon for the user's top favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user changed favorite teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN show the option to update their home screen icon modal again for the new favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is a first time user and comes to the page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the modal should not conflict with the Root IMS module
AND the user is shown the App Icon Modal

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a first time user comes to the page, is shown the App Icon Modal
AND the user does a second visit
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown the Root IMS modal

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is a product manager
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN allow a product manager to control when the popup appears via Adobe test and target based on whether the user has the icon and when they last saw the popup

title: Modals Does NOT Displays Under These Circumstances
custom_preconds: GIVEN as a product owner, I do not want to present users with the option to update their home screen icon
custom_steps: WHEN we control when a user sees this modal
custom_expected: THEN the modal cannot be displayed in the following scenarios:

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user is on their top favorite team page
AND if the user uses the picker to change teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN do NOT show the option to update their home screen icon

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user saw the on-boarding flow in the same session
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN do NOT show the option to update their home screen icon (avoid back to back icon messaging)

title: Modal's Copy, No Team Icon
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user accesses the modal to update their home screen icon
AND does not have a team icon on the homescreen
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the modal copy

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is on the Team page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the copy is as follows:
- Personalize your home screen
- Select the [TEAM] to change the First Pitch icon on your Home Screen
- Current Home Screen Icon - MiLB icon
- Not Now

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is on the Settings page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the copy is as follows:
- Personalize your home screen
- Select a [TEAM] to change the First Pitch icon on your Home screen
- Current Home Screen Icon - MiLB icon
- Reset to MiLB (Grayed Out)

title: Modal's Copy, Team Icon Selected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user accesses the modal to update their home screen icon
AND already has a team icon on the homescreen
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the modal copy

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is on the Team page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the copy is as follows:
- Personalize your home screen
- Selecte the [TEAM] to change the First Pitch icon on your home screen
- Current Home Screen Icon - Team Icon
- Newly Selected Favorite Team Icon
- Not Now

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is on the Settings page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the copy is as follows:
- Personalize your home screen
- You've selected the [TEAM] as the First Pitch icon on your home screen
- Current Home Screen Icon - Team Icon
- Reset to MiLB

title: Updating the Team Icon
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the team page
custom_steps: WHEN the user is within the change homescreen icon modal
custom_expected:
THEN the user can update to the team icon presented in the modal with one tap,
user views confirmation modal: You have changed the icon for "First Pitch" OK
AND updating the team icon dismisses the modal

title: Dismissing the Team Icon
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is on the team page
custom_steps: WHEN the user is within the change home icon modal
custom_expected:
THEN the user can dismiss the modal
AND dismissing the modal doesn't update the user's icon

title: Reset to MiLB icon
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has selected a homescreen team icon
custom_steps:
WHEN the user views the option to modify the home screen icon
AND resets to the default MiLB icon
custom_expected: THEN the user is able to reset to the default MiLB home screen icon

title: Notifications
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the has notifications turned on 
and user has selected a home screen icon
custom_steps: WHEN the user receives a notification
custom_expected: THEN notifications display with the default MiLB shield icon not the team icon

title: No Spanish Support
custom_preconds: GIVEN the device is set to Spanish
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to access the change home screen icon option
custom_expected: THEN the user is NOT presented with the option to update their home screen icon

title: Adobe Test and Target
custom_preconds:
Given a user has iOS 10.3 device
and MiLB installed
custom_steps: When Analytics and Product create a custom experience in Adobe Test and Target
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the custom experience
based on whether the user has the icon and when they last saw the popup

title: EDIT_Product Owner Updates, Delete, or Adds Icon options
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has set a home screen team icon
custom_steps: WHEN the product owner attempts to update, delete, add icon options
custom_expected: TBD

title: EDIT_Root IMS Module
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on iOS 10.3 device
and MiLB is installed
custom_steps:
When a user is in market with Root RSN
and has a favorite team of Astros, Rockies, Mariners or Pirates 
and the user navigates to the team page

custom_steps_separated.content: The first time a user comes to the page, show the App Icon Modal.
The second visit, show the Root IMS modal.

title: Customize App Icon Spanish Translations
custom_preconds:
When a user has two iOS 10.3 devices
and one device is set to English
and one device is set to Spanish
and has At Bat installed on both
custom_steps:
When the user is in At Bat
and on the Custom App Icon views
custom_expected: When the user compares the screens, they will see the following English (left) - Spanish (right) correlations

custom_steps_separated.content: Set Home Screen Icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Asigna el ícono para la pantalla principal

custom_steps_separated.content: Personalize your home screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: Personaliza tu pantalla principal

custom_steps_separated.content: Select the Orioles to change the At Bat icon on your home screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: Selecciona los Orioles para cambiar el ícono de At Bat en tu pantalla principal

custom_steps_separated.content: Current Icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Ícono actual

custom_steps_separated.content: You’ve selected the Orioles as the At Bat icon on your home screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: Seleccionaste a los Orioles como el ícono de At Bat para tu pantalla principal

custom_steps_separated.content: Current Home Screen Icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: Ícono actual de tu pantalla principal

custom_steps_separated.content: Not Now
custom_steps_separated.expected: Ahora no

title: Deep Links
custom_preconds:
When a user has iOS 10.3 
and has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When user has went through on boarding
custom_expected: and navigates to a deep link

custom_steps_separated.content:
with the app killed
and navigates to mlbatbat://settings?view=app_icon in Safari
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is taken to the App icon view

custom_steps_separated.content:
with the app in the background
and navigates to mlbatbat://settings?view=app_icon in Safari
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is taken to the App icon view

custom_steps_separated.content:
with the app backgrounded on Gameday
and navigates to mlbatbat://settings?view=app_icon in Safari
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is taken to the App icon view

custom_steps_separated.content:
with the app backgrounded on a modal (with Done button)
and navigates to mlbatbat://settings?view=app_icon in Safari
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user is taken to the App icon view

title: Team Page
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user navigates to the Team Page
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the option to modify the home screen icon
custom_expected:
THEN the user is able to:
- change to that team's icon
- see what their current icon is
- reset to the MiLB icon

title: Favorite Team Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has just selected a favorite team
AND lands on the favorite team page
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the option to modify the home screen icon
custom_expected:
THEN the user is presented with the option to update their home screen icon when they land on the team page so that they are aware this option is available. User is able to:
- change to that team's icon
- see what their current icon is
- reset to the MiLB icon

title: Team Settings
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user navigates to More, Teams
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects a teams and navigate to Settings
custom_expected:
THEN the user is able to:
- change to that team's icon
- see what their current icon is
- reset to the MiLB icon

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19681)

title: Global Settings
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user navigates to the More's Settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on Set Home Screen Icon
custom_expected:
THEN the user is taken to the Home Screen Icon page where

- the current selected icon is displayed
- all available icons are accessible
- If icons are organized by team (design pending), favorited and followed teams are brought to the top of the view, in the order specified by the user in their favorite/follow settings
- Tapping on the icon updates the icon for the user
